item.title: (WIP) Character encodings
item.description: ASCII I started attending an online class called the Bradfield Computer Science Intensive. I can tell you that I am learning a lot of new and exciting stuff. Stuff I should have learned in college, but didn’t. I might write a post about that someday. But for now Ill try and get straight to the point. Computers only speak one language. Its binary. The only 2 alphabets are [0, 1]. You can also think of them as [On, Off], [Up, Down].

item.title: About me
item.description: Github: arunsivasankaran About me I am a web developer. I live and work in LA. I work on the Platform team for a small startup. I am currently a student at Bradfield CS This blog is mostly about… Stuff I learn at bradfield. My opinions on backend web development.

item.title: Algorithms - Graphs
item.description: Undirected Graphs Some problems Path Shortest path Cycle Ehler tour: A cycle that uses each edge excatly once. Hamilton tour: A cycle that uses each vertex exactly once classical NP-complete problem. Connectivity MST: Biconnectivity: A vertex whose removal disconnects the graph Planarity Graph isomorphism: Are two graphs identical? No one knows so far. A lonstanding open problem Representations Real-world graphs tend to be sparse (huge number of vertices, small average vertex degree).
